7.1. Introduction¶

ITTIA DB provides strong security features to prevent unauthorized access to data and resilience against potential attacks.These capabilities alongside ITTIA’s security expertise allow device manufacturers and embedded system integrators to build solutions where sensitive data is protect both at rest and in motion. ITTIA DB SQL security features include encryption, authentication, and plugins for development of custom security capabilities.

To protect the confidentiality and integrity of the data from unauthorized access, database files on removable storage media should be encrypted. ITTIA DB SQL provides strong AES encryption that protects the entire database and stored data.

ITTIA DB SQL supports that authentication and protection of remote client/server communication. Remote communication can be authenticated using methods such as SCRAM which does not reveal passwords over the network or using a fully encrypted TLS connection. ITTIA DB SQL can also restrict access to a database through client/server communications with storage-level passwords. Additional security, where required, is also available through OpenSSL which encrypts remote connections.

ITTIA DB is developed and released under strict security considerations imposed by ITTIA’s SDL (Secure Development Lifecycle). Security aspects are embedded throughout the product cycle from design, coding, verification, to maintenance.

  • Security Planning: Security training and plans
  • Threat Model: Identify product security risks
  • Secure Design: Security is built in by design
  • Secure Coding: Static analysis and coding standards
  • Security Testing: Vulnerability and penetration tests
  • Incident Response: Incident detection and remedy

ITTIA offers capabilities to secure data and expertise to customize for specific use cases and embedded systems. With ITTIA DB SQL, data is always protected, and only authorized access is permitted. ITTIA’s SDL ensures security and privacy are built into our products from the start, rather than bolted on afterwards.
